summary: This is an email chain from December 2019 between attorney Robert Glassman and federal prosecutors regarding scheduling a meeting with a client (a victim/witness) for the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss logistical planning, including the client's childcare issues and the location of the client's mother.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP, representing a client (a victim/witness) in the SDNY investigation into Epstein and Maxwell. He is coordinating a meeting with prosecutors.

persons.name: Nathan Werksman
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, appears to be a colleague or co-counsel involved in the case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject of the SDNY investigation, with prosecutors intending to discuss his specific conduct.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named alongside Epstein as a subject of the SDNY investigation, with prosecutors intending to discuss her specific conduct.

connections.description: Both are copied on legal correspondence regarding the SDNY investigation, indicating they are working together on the case.
Glassman's client is a victim/witness in the investigation into Epstein's conduct.
Glassman's client is a victim/witness in the investigation into Maxwell's conduct.

events.title: Meeting Rescheduled Due to Childcare
events.description: Robert Glassman informs prosecutors that his client's nanny canceled, forcing a rescheduling of their meeting from December 16 to December 17.

events.title: Prosecutors Outline Meeting Agenda
events.description: Prosecutors email Glassman confirming a meeting and outlining topics: victim/witness travel, investigation steps for corroboration, and specific conduct by Epstein and/or Maxwell.

keyFacts: The email chain is a scheduling discussion between a victim's attorney (Robert Glassman) and SDNY prosecutors in December 2019, showing active investigation into Epstein/Maxwell.
Prosecutors explicitly state their intent to discuss "specific conduct by Epstein and/or Maxwell" with the victim/witness.
The victim/witness's mother is reported to be living overseas, not in the United States.
The correspondence reveals the careful, coordinated planning between legal teams for witness interviews, including considerations for the witness's personal life (childcare).
